item.name: Primary Data

request.description:
Request that pulls all entries from the primary data collection with a matching organization ID. To use, replace `organization_ID` with the ID of the organization in question.

This was mainly used to test the connection between Postman, the API, and our MongoDB.

A simple request that pulls the related primary data entry based on the ID input. Shows all relevant information input during the initial data entry process, along with the automated organization ID input.

To use, replace `primary_ID` with the ID of the primary data entry.

response.name: GET Primary Data by ID Example

request.description:
Pulls **all** records that match the search query specified. Only shows queries that have a matching organization ID. Can search by either name or phone number.

To use, replace `query` with either `name` or `number`.

If using `name`, add in the name to search by including `&firstName=&lastName=`, replacing `first` and `last` accordingly.

If using `number`, add in the phone number to search by including `&phoneNumbers.primaryPhone`, replacing `phone` with the entirety or section of the phone number to search by.

Will give all results that match the search criteria, even if an exact match isn't made in the query parameters.

response.name: GET Primary Data by Name Query
GET Primary Data by Phone Query

body.raw:
{
    "firstName": "<first name>",
    "middleName": "<middle name>",
    "lastName": "<last name>",
    "email": "<email>",
    "address.line1": "<address line 1>",
    "address.line2": "<address line 2>",
    "address.county": "<county>",
    "address.zip": "<zip>",
    "address.city": "<city>",
    "phoneNumbers.0.primaryPhone": <phone number>,
    "phoneNumbers.0.secondaryPhone": <phone number>
}

request.description: Posts a primary data entry to the database. All fields included in the body below are acceptable as inputs, however the only fields that are **required** are `firstName`, `lastName`, `phoneNumbers.0.primaryphone`, and `address.city`.

body.raw:
{
    "firstName": "<first name>",
    "middleName": "<middle name>",
    "lastName": "<last name>",
    "email": "<email>",
    "address.line1": "<address line 1>",
    "address.line2": "<address line 2>",
    "address.county": "<county>",
    "address.zip": "<zip>",
    "address.city": "<city>",
    "phoneNumbers.0.primaryPhone": <phone number>,
    "phoneNumbers.0.secondaryPhone": <phone number>
}

request.description:
Updates a record based on the ID in the parameters and the body of the request.

To use, replace `primary_id` with the ID of the primary data entry and use any of the potential editable fields from the previously seen POST body to update those fields. Any field not included will be ignored and untouched- only the specified fields will be updated.

Do **not** include ID in the body of the request. Only include the ID of the primary data entry in the parameters.

Upon a successful request, the API will return the full record of the specified primary data **before** the update was complete in Postman. This is to verify that the targeted primary data was correct.

Deletes a primary data entirely along with its record in any event that the entry was a part of. The event record deletion process is automated by the API- all that's requires is to run the delete request and everything else is handled accordingly.

Replace `primary_ID` with the ID you wish to delete. The API will return the entire record of the primary data before deletion to confirm what was actually deleted.

item.description: Below are all related API requests for Primary Data entries.

item.name: Event Data

request.description: Returns all event data entries within the current organization. No parameters need to be passed, the organization ID is automatically passed through to only show relevant events for the organization.

response.name: GET ALL Event Data Example
response.body:
[
    {
        "address": {
            "line1": "123 Lily Ln.",
            "line2": "",
            "city": "Houston",
            "county": "Harris",
            "zip": "77004"
        },
        "_id": "43404a50-3f4a-11ed-b457-dfbc754ec8be",
        "eventName": "Celebrity Basketball Game",
        "services": [
            "Youth Services Program"
        ],
        "date": "2022-10-16T00:00:00.000Z",
        "description": "",
        "attendees": [
            "97c23390-3f4a-11ed-b457-dfbc754ec8be",
            "a4989c50-3f4d-11ed-a199-ff9ef83ee7ee",
            "923f74d0-3f4c-11ed-a199-ff9ef83ee7ee"
        ],
        "__v": 0,
        "organization_id": "63347428cf20211ac2ba4db0"
    },
    {
        "address": {
            "line1": "339 Portwood St.",
            "line2": "",
            "city": "Spring",
            "county": "Harris",
            "zip": "77373"
        },
        "_id": "2a64ce60-3f4b-11ed-b457-dfbc754ec8be",
        "eventName": "Spring Branch Art Sale",
        "services": [
            "Family Support"
        ],
        "date": "2022-10-29T00:00:00.000Z",
        "description": "",
        "attendees": [
            "7dccb4c0-3f4e-11ed-a199-ff9ef83ee7ee",
            "35b867b0-3f4e-11ed-a199-ff9ef83ee7ee",
            "587b7130-3f4d-11ed-a199-ff9ef83ee7ee"
        ],
        "__v": 0,
        "organization_id": "63347428cf20211ac2ba4db0"

]

request.description:
StartFragment

A simple request that pulls the related event data entry based on the ID input. Shows all relevant information input during the initial data entry process, along with the automated organization ID input.

To use, replace `event_ID` with the ID of the event data entry.

EndFragment

request.description: Returns all events that the specified client is marked to be attending within the database. Replace `client_ID` with the client's ID.

request.description:
Pulls **all** records that match the search query specified. Only shows queries that have a matching organization ID. Can search by either name or phone number.

To use, replace `query` with either `name` or `date`.

If using `name`, add in the name to search by including `&eventName=NAME`, replacing `NAME` accordingly.

If using `date`, add in the date to search by including `&eventDate=YYYY-MM-DD`, replacing `YYYY-MM-DD` with the respective date to search by, following that same date format.

Will give all results that match the search criteria, even if an exact match isn't made in the query parameters.

request.description:
Get request that pulls the amount of attendees that are signed to attend events each month. The response from the API gives the month in question along with the amount of attendees for events in that month.

`_id` refers to the month of the events in question. For example, an `_id` response of `10` would be October. `attendees_count` returns the exact number of attendees that are marked to be attending events within that month.
Posts a event data entry to the database. All fields included in the body below are acceptable as inputs, however the only fields that are **required** are `eventName` and `date`.

response.name: POST Event Data Example

body.raw:
{
    "eventName": "Test Event",
    "services": "Family Support",
    "date": "2022-10-19",
    "address.line1": "Test Address",
    "description": "This is a test",
    "attendees": "5c5f2f70-401b-11ed-96ed-b5ba35dd398c"
}

request.description:
Updates a record based on the ID in the parameters and the body of the request.

To use, replace `event_id` with the ID of the event data entry and use any of the potential editable fields from the previously seen POST body to update those fields. Any field not included will be ignored and untouched- only the specified fields will be updated.

Do **not** include ID in the body of the request. Only include the ID of the event data entry in the parameters.

Upon a successful request, the API will return the full record of the specified event data **before** the update was complete in Postman. This is to verify that the targeted event data was correct.

response.name: PUT Event Data Example

request.description:
Updates a record based on the ID in the parameters and the body of the request by inserting a new attendee.

To use, replace `event_id` with the ID of the event data entry and replace `client_ID` with the ID of the attendee to add.

Do **not** include the event ID in the body of the request. Only include the ID of the event data entry in the parameters.

Upon a successful request, the API will return an acknowledgement confirming the addition.

response.name: PUT Event Data Attendee Addition Example

request.description:
Updates a record based on the ID in the parameters and the body of the request by removing an existing attendee.

To use, replace `event_id` with the ID of the event data entry and replace `client_ID` with the ID of the attendee to remove.

Do **not** include the event ID in the body of the request. Only include the ID of the event data entry in the parameters.

Upon a successful request, the API will return an acknowledgement confirming the removal.

Deletes an event data entirely. Since attendees are assigned within the event data document instead of on the primary data document, attendees do not need to be unassigned by any other process. Simply deleting the event data will inherently unassign the client from that event.

Replace `event_ID` with the ID you wish to delete. The API will return the entire record of the event data before deletion to confirm what was actually deleted.

item.description: All requests related to the Event Data backend API.

item.name: Organization Data

request.description:
Pulls information about the organization data for use on the frontend. Since the only thing stored by the organization is their name and ID, it will only return those two fields.

Replace `organization-ID` with the organization's ID.

item.description: Requests for information from the organization as a whole.
